alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Surry; Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 9:09PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall will continue across eastern Alleghany, northwestern Surry, and eastern Wilkes Counties in northwestern North Carolina through 1000 PM EDT... At 907 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of showers and thunderstorms with heavy rainfall extending from North Wilkesboro to Low Gap, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Traphill... Ennice... Mountain Park... Bottom... and Roaring Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for north central and northwestern North Carolina...and southwestern Virginia.
